text: A sister is both your mirror – and your opposite.
author: Elizabeth Fishel

text: Sisters are like stars. You may not always see them, but you know they’re always there.
author: Unknown

text: A sister is a little bit of childhood that can never be lost.
author: Marion C. Garretty

text: Sisters may drive you crazy, but they are the ones who know you the best.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters are the people we practice on, the people who teach us about fairness and cooperation and kindness and caring.
author: Pamela Dugdale

text: A sister is one who reaches for your hand and touches your heart.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters are like flowers, each one is unique and special in their own way.
author: Unknown

text: A sister is a gift to the heart, a friend to the spirit, a golden thread to the meaning of life.
author: Isadora James

text: Sisters are angels who lift us to our feet when our wings have trouble remembering how to fly.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters are the friends who know all of your secrets but love you anyway.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters help you find important things when you have lost them. Things like your smiles, your hopes, and your courage.
author: Unknown

text: A sister’s love is like a cup of hot cocoa on a cold day.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters are different flowers from the same garden.
author: Unknown

text: A sister is someone who knows everything about you and still loves you.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters may fight and argue, but at the end of the day, they’re still each other’s biggest supporters.
author: Unknown

text: A sister is a forever friend.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters are the best kind of friends.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters are like sunshine on a rainy day.
author: Unknown

text: A sister’s smile is the brightest of all.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters are like cookies in a jar – there’s always a few sweet ones.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters are the perfect best friend.
author: Unknown

text: A sister can be seen as someone who is both ourselves and very much not ourselves – a special kind of double.
author: Toni Morrison

text: Sisters are like stars in the night sky; always shining brightly, even when you can’t see them.
author: Unknown

text: A sister is a forever friend and guardian of childhood memories.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters are different chocolates from the same box.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters share childhood memories and grown-up dreams.
author: Unknown

text: A sister is one of the nicest things you can have, and one of the best things you can be.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters are the ones who catch you when you fall.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters may drive you insane, but they are the reason you smile when life gets tough.
author: Unknown

text: A sister is a special type of angel on earth who brings out your best qualities.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters are the friends you never knew you needed.
author: Unknown

text: A sister is a piece of childhood that can never be lost.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters are like stars; you may not always see them, but you know they’re always there.
author: Unknown

text: A sister is a second self.
author: Aristotle

text: Sisters are the people you can count on, even when you can’t count on yourself.
author: Unknown

text: Sisters are forever, and so is the love they share.
author: Unknown
